question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration.
Please help me implement the following requirement using SVG code: create a Nintendo controller and icons playing video games, for a minimal entertainment activity.

checklist.title: Is the Nintendo controller structure accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code accurately recreates the Nintendo controller's iconic structure through proper geometric shapes and proportions. Check if it includes essential elements like D-pad, action buttons (A/B), shoulder buttons, analog sticks, and the characteristic controller body shape. Score 0 if only basic rectangles are used, 5 if controller outline is recognizable but lacks detail, and 10 if all controller components are accurately proportioned and positioned according to authentic Nintendo controller design.

checklist.title: Are the gaming icons and visual elements professionally designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the gaming icons (characters, items, UI elements) are implemented with clean SVG paths and demonstrate gaming aesthetics. Check for proper use of vector graphics principles, scalable design, and gaming-themed iconography. Icons should be instantly recognizable and maintain visual consistency. Deduct 5 points if icons are poorly vectorized or pixelated, deduct 3 points if gaming theme is not clearly conveyed. Full score requires professional-grade gaming iconography.

checklist.title: Is the minimal entertainment activity concept effectively realized?
checklist.description: Assess whether the implementation successfully creates an engaging minimal entertainment experience through interactive elements or visual storytelling. Check if the controller and icons work together to suggest or enable actual gaming interaction. The design should communicate 'playfulness' and 'entertainment' immediately. Deduct 5 points if no interactive elements are present, deduct 3 points if the entertainment aspect is unclear or confusing.

checklist.title: Is the SVG structure optimized and semantically correct?
checklist.description: Review the SVG code structure for proper use of groups, layers, and semantic organization. Check if the code uses appropriate SVG elements (rect, circle, path, polygon) efficiently and includes proper viewBox settings for scalability. Evaluate whether the code is clean, readable, and follows SVG best practices. Deduct 5 points if excessive nested groups are used, deduct 3 points if viewBox is incorrectly set, deduct 5 points if inline styles are used instead of proper SVG attributes.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, scaling problems, rendering errors) and provide fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should work consistently across different browsers and screen sizes, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no compatibility considerations are made, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Hover animations on controller buttons 2. CSS keyframe animations for gaming effects 3. Interactive SVG elements that respond to clicks 4. Creative use of SVG filters or gradients). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that serve no visual purpose 2. Overly complex paths that could be simplified 3. Unnecessary styling that doesn't contribute to the gaming theme. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visual concept is obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG code organization, proper use of comments, consistent naming conventions, and maintainable structure. Deduct 5 points if SVG elements are not properly organized or grouped; deduct 5 points if the code lacks readability or uses inconsistent formatting; deduct 5 points if no consideration is given to file size optimization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching that reflects Nintendo's brand aesthetics 2) Proper proportions and spacing that maintain visual balance 3) Professional use of typography if text elements are included 4) Clean, minimalist approach suitable for entertainment context. Deduct 3 points for each visually jarring element, 5 points for poor color harmony, and 5 points for unbalanced composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any interactive elements or animations conform to user experience principles: 1) Smooth CSS transitions if hover effects are implemented 2) Appropriate animation timing and easing 3) Clear visual feedback for interactive elements 4) Intuitive visual hierarchy that guides user attention. Deduct 5 points for each missing interaction feedback, 3 points for choppy animations, and 5 points for confusing visual flow. The full score is 10 points.
